title: Album Page, "Elevation and Section of Farmhouse", September 18, 1890
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite, traces of pen and red ink on textured off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner: 75; lower right corner: 63; clockwise from bottom left corner of sheet: Maison d'une fa.... canton du Grande B..rn..and / dans la Haute Savoie - / Septemer 18 1890-; Some pieces of the / construction are immense /  This piece of wood was 0.25 x 0.50 [cataloguer's note: the scale is meters]; thickness of layers of shingles on roof / averages 0.20 / .30 x .50; The walls are held in place by "keys" of wood seen in section and front / elevation - the thickness of walls is generally M0.15 (fifteen centimeters) between / the logs to close joints moss is laid - / These houses are said to be / very warm in winter and cool in summer -  Expensive as wood is / becoming scarce - valued now at about 7000 to 8000 francs - The / grainery [sic] is used to store valuables such as money linen wheat etc - / chimney M3.00 sq at bottom, said to be too large by M 1.00.
description: Vertical sheet divided into two horizontal registers.  The upper register illustrates the elevation of a masonry and timber farmhouse that appears to be built into a hill.  Below this is a section through of the same building above, illustrating the various rooms and their contents.  The lower drawing has many inscriptions regarding the dimensions of various components of the building.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Elevation and Section of Farmhouse", September 18, 1890.Brush and watercolor, graphite, traces of pen and red ink on textured off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-236.
